moves.2... dxc4: the other, a piece of earth, dumped infront of you...
moves.5. axb3: the unlikely opponent, formed and shaped itself...
moves.9. Ne2 e6 10. O-O Bd6 11. Qc2 f5 12. Re1: I liked this part of the game:)
moves.25... Kh7 26. Re7: a queen can be the biggest disadvantage on the board...I made two attacking moves and used her to slingshot myself into position
moves.27... Rxd3 28. Nf8+: both those pieces, the rook and the night got there, not because of anything that provide cover for them, but I managed to bend the rules of value...to my advantage...the attack has to be fluent
moves.28... Kh8: Qf7 was the other option if oponent went Kg8
